results.title: Deep sea trawler
results.brief_description: Part of the “Man and his world” series, this film describes a trawler’s voyage from its home port on the North Sea to the Grand Banks off Newfoundland. Shows the complete operation of catching and processing the fish.

results.title: Deep sea drilling project
results.creator_credit: National Science Foundation and Jack Robinson
results.brief_description: Shows how ocean bottom cores are obtained and what they tell about the drifting of continents throughout the ages. Documents the voyages of the Clomar Challenger, a new class of drilling ship able to probe deep beneath the floors of the oceans.
results.description: Shows how ocean bottom cores are obtained and what they tell about the drifting of continents throughout the ages. Documents the voyages of the Clomar Challenger, a new class of drilling ship able to probe deep beneath the floors of the oceans.

results.title: Deep sea dive
results.brief_description: Explore the last great frontier on earth - under the sea. Join Spin, an animated globe-on-the-go (voice provided by Dudley Moore), as he explores the world’s ocean from surface to seafloor. Learn about the great whales, friendly dolphins, scary sharks, and all the oceans’ amazing treasures. Brilliant cinematography and magical music videos make this undersea world of wonders come alive. Suitable for Lower-Middle Primary level students.

results.title: Deep hearts
results.creator_credit: Harvard University. Film Study Center and Robert Gardner
results.brief_description: About the Bororo Fulani of the Niger Republic in Africa. The Bororo are a nomadic tribe, moving with their cattle across the Sahel desert each year to gather in large numbers at certain watering places to celebrate their vision of themselves as chosen beings and to enjoy one another’s company. Dressed in ceremonial attire, they celebrate the yearly rains by singing and dancing.

results.title: Deep fat frying
results.brief_description: Presents basic information on deep fat frying, stressing the equipment to be used, the prevention of fat absorption, and the care of fats to prevent decomposition. Shows how to get the highest quality and dollar savings from this cooking method.

results.title: Deep blue world
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, David Adams and Ken Rudolf
results.brief_description: Traces an underwater adventure in a colour fantasy of oceanic forms. Takes the viewer to a dark mysterious world, accented by an electronic music score. The diver encounters colour caves of sea anemones, the pastel shades of which build to an exciting brightness, and then returns to the blue surface. Stills set to music. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Deconstructing Harry. Mighty Aphrodite
results.brief_description: Mighty Aphrodite (1995): Writer-director Woody Allen plays Lenny, a sportswriter who is dissatisfied in his marriage to art dealer, Amanda. Lenny becomes obsessed with locating his adopted son’s natural mother, feeling convinced that she will be a brilliant and intelligent person. Instead she’s Linda, a ditzy porn star and prostitute. Despite the initial disillusionment, Lenny soon develops a fondness for Linda, and decides to help her get her life back on track. Cast includes: Woody Allen, Mira Sorvino, Helena Bonham Carter, Michael Rapaport, F. Murray Abraham, Olympia Dukakis and Peter Weller. Deconstructing Harry (1997): Harry (Woody Allen), a New York author, has just released his latest novel, “loosely” based on the characters from his own life - his ex-wives, mistresses, family and analysts. No-one likes his depiction of them, and in an hilariously ironic mixture of flashbacks to his new novel, flashbacks to his past, and mishaps in the present, the true story comes out. In classic Allen style, this autobiographical story is a fascinating mixture of fiction and reality. The cast is another line-up of characters in itself,including Kirstie Alley, Demi Moore, Robin Williams, Billy Crystal, Elisabeth Shue, Stanley Tucci, Amy Irving, Julie Kavner, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Mariel Hemingway and Judy Davis.
